alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Very heavy rainfall from thunderstorms impacting southern Carroll and far southwestern Patrick Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Carroll and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Doe Run Creek, Elk Spur Branch, Lovills Creek, Big Reed Island Creek, Little Pauls Creek, Johnson Creek, Chestnut Creek, Ararat River, Grassy Creek, Hanks Branch, East Fork Crooked Creek, Brushy Fork, Garners Creek, Little Fisher River and Crooked Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cana... Fancy Gap... Lambsburg... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
